title: Former acne and psoriasis sufferer
text: Share this article Share She believes her first flare-up was caused by her poor diet, the stress of GCSE exams and her parents splitting up. 'It began as a lot of little red dots on my tummy,' she said. 'I still remember the doctor telling me 'There is no cure". The thought of being stuck with it forever was horrific.' Hanna's arm before, left, and after. Hanna went to extreme lengths to get rid of her psoriasis and even tried coal tar shampoo which her boyfriend said made her smell of 'tarmac' Transformation: Before overhauling her diet and clearing up her skin, Hanna describes herself as being 'lazy, fat and covered up all the time' and she would normally dine on wine and pizza Hanna's hand before, left, and now. She was 'always the spotty one' amongst her friends growing up and struggled with severe acne throughout her school years Pictures of Hanna's tummy, taken before and after overhauling her diet, show the incredible difference in both her skin and her body shape as it also helped her slim down Hanna went to extreme lengths to get rid of her psoriasis and even tried coal tar shampoo which her boyfriend joked made her smell of 'tarmac', but to no avail - it got so bad she began dreading holidays and summer weddings where her skin would be on show. 'I used foundation and concealer on my arms, I wore long sleeves and trousers in summer, I did everything I could to cover up and hide,' Hanna said. 'I absolutely hated my skin.' On one occasion, she was waiting to board a flight to Egypt when the girl behind the check-in desk started pointing and called for her colleague. Covering up: While suffering from psoriasis, Hanna would wear gloves to cover her hands. She believes her first flare-up was caused by her poor diet, the stress of GCSE exams and her parents splitting up Hanna covers up during a sunny day on the beach. 'My skin was at its worst here,' says Hanna. 'I was wearing gloves to stop people commenting on my hands and I could barely open my eyes because the eczema on my eyelids was so bad' 'In front of a long queue of people they began a huge discussion over whether my skin was contagious,' Hanna recalled. 'I was absolutely distraught.' During her worst flares, the pain and itching was 'unbearable' and Hanna would wake up to 10 times in the night to slather on moisturiser to try and soothe it. Once, travelling to London for a meeting, she covered her body in coconut oil and wrapped herself in clingfilm to stop the clothes from rubbing against her skin. Over the years she tried 'countless prescription creams, shampoos and emollients', many containing coal tar and steroids, to little avail. Hanna now. Before clearing up her skin, she 'used foundation and concealer on my arms, I wore long sleeves and trousers in summer, I did everything I could to cover up and hide' Glowing: Hanna has had a new lease of life and has got into exercise since switching up her diet. Her new 'alkaline-focused' diet is full of nuts, greens and seeds Clear skin: Hanna, pictured today, has an enviable glow and her acne, psoriasis and eczema troubles are a thing of the past Finally, three years ago, she went to her doctor 'in despair' and he suggested Methotrexate, an immune system suppressant. 'I was shocked,' said Hanna. 'This was chemotherapy medication and I didn't have cancer, just a skin problem. 'I went home to read and research a little more. The list of side effects - which include organ failure - made the decision an easy one. I was petrified, there was absolutely no way I was going down that route.' Hanna began trawling the internet for alternative solutions and read about men who had healed their autoimmune skin conditions by juicing - extracting the juice from fresh fruit and vegetables to give their bodies a 'break from digestion'. 'From that day onwards my skin got better and better': Hanna says she saw a little change 'each day' after embarking on her new lifestyle three years ago Hanna recently launched a blog, MyGoodnessRecipes.com, with her favourite new recipes which led to a free guide and eventually a book of all her favourite dishes called Radiant 'I absolutely love food and knew I couldn't live on juice for the rest of my life,' said Hanna, who began developing her own anti-inflammatory recipes despite having 'n catering experience whatsoever. 'I'd lived on pasta and tomato sauce out of jars forever,' Hanna admitted. 'The process really was very much trial and error but I loved the challenge.' Despite an initial flare-up, her skin began to clear up just two weeks into her new 'alkaline-focused' diet full of nuts, greens and seeds. 'From that day onward my skin got better and better,' Hanna said. 'Each day there was a little change. Lifestyle overhaul: The confidence that came from her newfound glow also gave Hanna the boost needed to start exercising which has seen her lose weight too New start: Hanna now describes herself as an 'author, dietician and chef' and travels the country attending food festivals as well as helping other women suffering from psoriasis Hanna's Vegan Blackberry Marble Cheesecake The vitamins A, C and K in blackberries are excellent for skin rejuvenation.
